history.content: I can't speak for your Fall18 schedule, but your spring19 schedule looks kinda insane imo, 162 and 189 both have extremely, extremely high workloads, and i've heard 120 is also very conceptually challenging as well

I constructed a set of six well rounded upper division classes I want to take my senior year (graduating in May '19) but it seems a I have a conflict between 120 and 170 for fall. 

Fall '18: EE 120, CS 170, EECS 127 
Spring '19: EE 128, CS 162, CS 189

So, I am looking at making adjustments and I was hoping for advice on combinations/timing. My selection of courses is based on my interest in Robotics/AI and my uncertainty of whether I want to do grad school. I am open to alternate course suggestions, if the argument is compelling. I plan to look for an internship (or job?) beginning this Fall and I am told 170 helps build intuition for questions asked in interviews. However, 120 is a pre-req for 128. Based on this, I feel like the following are my options:

1. Don't take 170 until spring and will not have that in my back pocket while interviewing. 
Fall'18: 120/127162
Spring'19: 170/189/128
Questions: How important is 170 for interviews? Is 162 useful for interviews?

2. Don't take 120 until Spring and take it concurrent with 128. Also, that would mean taking 162 and 170 at the same time.
Fall'18: 170/127/162
Spring'19: 120/128/189
Questions: How much is 120 used in 128 and is it a bad idea to take them side by side? How miserable will it be to take 170 and 162 together? I hear they are work load heavy.

3. Submit a conflict form and take the classes as planned.
Fall'18: 127/120/170
Spring'19: 128/189/162
Questions: Is this even possible? Aren't the finals at the same time? Are one or both webcast? How much of a disadvantage will it be to watch 120 or 170 over webcast instead of in person?

Any advice or answers from professors or students is appreciated. I want to make the most of the last of my time here but not struggle unnecessarily.
